prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Manfred von Karma
Description: My mentor who has never known defeat in 35 years. A legendary prosecutor.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Prosecutor in Embassy staff killing case. Accused by Rell of being the Yatagarasu.
Character 2
Name: Deid Mann
Description: Cohdopian Embassy staff member. Was gunned down in front of Embassy by Rell.
Character 3
Name: Mack Rell
Description: Embassy staff killing suspect. Arrested on suspicion for the handgun he was carrying.
Character 4
Name: Yatagarasu
Description: Real identity is unknown, but claims to be a noble thief. Infiltrated the Embassy.
Character 5
Name: ??? → Kay Faraday
Description: A girl with a balloon. During the recess, she asked me to change some coins for her.
Character 6
Name: The Judge
Description: Judge in Embassy staff killing case.
Character 7
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: New rookie detective at the precinct. First crime scene. Seems very enthusiastic.
Character 8
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Lawyer of embassy staff killing defendant, Rell. I was to battle her in court.
Character 9
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. Was called in to be expert witness on the Yatagarasu case.
Character 10
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: Cohdopian Embassy staff member. He was the suspect in the KG-8 Incident.
Character 11
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor's daughter. Studying to be a prosecutor in Germany, back on break.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. My mentor said it was more chic to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: KG-8 Incident Overview
Description: Received from my mentor as reference about KG-8.
Evidence 2
Name: Det. Gumshoe's Testimony
Description: Was in hall on guard duty. Other than gunshot, didn't hear a sign of a struggle.
Evidence 3
Name: Handgun
Description: Was Faraday's evidence from Embassy staff killing case. It was found in his hand. Found in Faraday's hand. Bullet that killed Rell was fired from a few yards away.
Evidence 4
Name: Knife
Description: I believe Faraday brought this as evidence. It was found in Rell's hand. Weapon used to kill Faraday. Has the secret ability to change into key the Yatagarasu sent.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Notes
Description: Notes pertaining to Byrne Faraday and Mack Rell.
Evidence 6
Name: Plastic Bag
Description: One of the bags strewn on floor of Lobby No. 2. Has Faraday's blood on it.
Evidence 7
Name: Mr. Faraday's Fountain Pen
Description: Fountain pen used by the left-handed Faraday. Looks like it has a quality nib.
Evidence 8
Name: Annual Bonus Envelope
Description: Det. Gumshoe's annual bonus of $5. Literally had no money on him until he cashed this.
Evidence 9
Name: Swiss Roll
Description: Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. Says "Courthouse Special" on it. Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. It's priced at 2 for $6. Detective Gumshoe and Kay bought this Swiss roll together.
Evidence 10
Name: Det. Badd's Testimony
Description: He heard the gunshot right before the trial was about to start again.
Evidence 11
Name: Det. Gumshoe's Fingerprints
Description: Left on the hallway bench. Black smudge emits the scent of sweet sugar. Left on the hallway bench. Det. Gumshoe apparently sat here as he ate a Swiss roll.
Evidence 12
Name: Balloon Piece
Description: I just know I've seen a pink balloon around... Found on windowsill of the hallway window. Balloon popped by Kay. The Judge misheard its popping for a gunshot.
Evidence 13
Name: Promise Notebook
Description: Exchange diary between Mr. Faraday and Kay.
Evidence 14
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: Perfume given to Badd by Yew. Same perfume as the one spilled in Lobby No. 1.
Evidence 15
Name: Mr. Faraday's Organizer
Description: Faraday wrote his strategy for winning in here.
Evidence 16
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: Photo of key the Yatagarasu sent. Unusual shape. Photo of the key the Yatagarasu sent. Turns into knife.
Evidence 17
Name: Surveillance Video
Description: Video of the Embassy staff member's murder. Gunshot is especially impactful.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I suppose it's possible you can't see a seated person from the restroom window.
Person: Judge
Testimony 1
Testimony: However, that doesn't mean that the Detective was sitting there when I looked!
Person: Judge
Testimony 2
Testimony: Let's see... I looked into that hallway about 20 minutes before we were to reconvene.
Person: Judge
Testimony 3
Testimony: Anyway! I forgot to testify earlier about probably the most important detail...
Person: Judge
Testimony 4
Testimony: As I was leaving the restroom, I heard the loud "BANG!" of a gunshot!
Person: Judge

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let me try to figure this out. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let's start by going through the testimonies and evidences to see where there's a conflict.

First, looking at the testimonies given by the Judge. Testimony 3 says the Judge forgot to mention the most important detail, which in Testimony 4 is hearing a gunshot when leaving the restroom. The Judge claims he heard a loud bang that he thought was a gunshot. But looking at the evidence, Evidence 12 is the Balloon Piece. The description says the Judge misheard the balloon popping for a gunshot. So if the balloon popping was actually the sound the Judge heard, then his testimony about the gunshot (Testimony 4) would be contradicted by Evidence 12, which explains it was a balloon, not a real gunshot.

Wait, but Testimony 4 is the one where the Judge says he heard the gunshot. Evidence 12 states that the balloon popped and the Judge misheard it as a gunshot. Therefore, the testimony about hearing a gunshot (Testimony 4) is contradicted by Evidence 12, which shows it was actually a balloon pop. So the evidence 12 and testimony 4 would be the contradiction. But looking back, the user's answer needs to be in the format of evidence number and testimony number.

Wait, Evidence 12 is the Balloon Piece. The testimony in question is Testimony 4, which is the Judge's statement about hearing the gunshot. So the existence of the balloon piece (Evidence 12) contradicts the Judge's testimony (Testimony 4) that it was a gunshot. Therefore, the correct pair is evidence 12 and testimony 4.

But let me double-check. Testimony 4: "As I was leaving the restroom, I heard the loud 'BANG!' of a gunshot!" Evidence 12: "Balloon popped by Kay. The Judge misheard its popping for a gunshot." So the evidence shows that the sound was a balloon, not a gunshot, which directly contradicts the Judge's testimony. Therefore, the pair should be evidence 12 and testimony 4.

cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user wants me to find one pair where the evidence directly contradicts a specific testimony. Let me start by going through the testimonies and the evidences one by one.

First, looking at the testimonies from Gumshoe. Testimony 3 says that he didn't take a single step away from the Lobby No. 2 door until he heard the gunshot. But looking at the evidence, Evidence 11 is Det. Gumshoe's Fingerprints left on the hallway bench. The description mentions that he sat there while eating a Swiss roll. So if he was sitting on the bench, he wasn't right by the door. That directly contradicts his testimony where he claims he didn't step away. Also, Evidence 9 (Swiss Roll) mentions that Gumshoe and Kay bought it together, which aligns with him eating it on the bench. So the fingerprints on the bench (Evidence 11) show he was away from the door, contradicting Testimony 3. Wait, but the question says to pick one pair. Let me check again.

Alternatively, Evidence 11's description says the fingerprints are on the bench, which suggests he sat there. If he was supposed to be guarding the door (Testimony 3 says he didn't step away), then sitting on the bench away from the door would be a contradiction. So Evidence 11 (fingerprints on bench) contradicts Testimony 3 (didn't step away). That seems like a solid contradiction. I think that's the pair. Let me make sure there's no other contradictions. Another possibility is Testimony 3 and Evidence 11. So the answer should be evidence 11 and testimony 3. Wait, but in the given list, Evidence 11 is "Det. Gumshoe's Fingerprints", and Testimony 3 is "And until I heard the gunshot, I didn't take a single step away from the Lobby No. 2 door." Therefore, the presence of his fingerprints on the bench, which is in the hallway, means he must have moved from the door to the bench, contradicting his testimony. So yes, evidence 11 contradicts testimony 3.
